I know that when the Bodhisattva first gave rise to the mind of enlightenment, he saw that sentient beings were attached to self and possessions, covered by ignorance, entering various wrong views, following after craving and love, bound by desire and anger, their minds confused and inverted, entangled by stinginess and jealousy, oppressed by poverty, and in the midst of birth and death, experiencing various sufferings and afflictions, without encountering the Buddhas.

Having seen this, he gave rise to a mind of great compassion, embraced sentient beings, removed their various sufferings and afflictions, universally benefiting them, enabling them to attain a mind free from defilements and attachments;
with regard to all objects of giving, not seeking any rewards, discerning and understanding the true characteristics of all dharmas and their causes and conditions;

In every thought, filling all Dharma realms;

In the past, when Vairocana Buddha was practicing the bodhisattva path, he saw that sentient beings lacked wisdom and merit, were covered by foolishness, and attached to self and what belongs to self;

They entered various wrong views and did not recognize cause and effect;
They followed the karma of afflictions and did not cultivate the holy path;
They attained effortless dharmas and always flowed through the dangerous paths of birth and death, experiencing various sufferings.
He aroused great compassion and caused sentient beings to give rise to the bodhisattvas' immeasurable practices and cultivate all perfections;
He established them firmly in excellent and wonderful roots of goodness, eliminated various sufferings, and increased the treasury of merits;
He understood cause and effect, did not violate karmic retribution, and knew the true reality of dharmas;

He fully distinguished and understood the desires and inclinations of sentient beings and all lands, guarded and upheld all Buddha-Dharmas, caused them not to be cut off, eliminated unwholesome dharmas, and fulfilled omniscience.
